message.content:
{"id": "24877", 
"title": "Cannot get file extension from swt FileDialog", 
"description": "When using swt FileDialog, it is not possible to retrieve the file extension that the user selected. This can be problematic when determining the correct file extension to append to the file name. As a result, the dialog becomes almost unusable. This issue can be observed when exporting to a jar file in our own product.", 
"OB": "The FileDialog class does not provide an API to access the 'Save as type' field that the user selected in the dialog. We need an API to retrieve this information.", 
"EB": "Currently, when using the FileDialog, if the user selects the 'Save as type' field as .zip and enters a file name (e.g. test), the behavior is as follows.", 
"SR": "1. Open the FileDialog. \n2. Select .zip in the 'Save as type' field. \n3. Enter a file name, e.g. test."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '24877', 'title': 'Bug 24877Cannot get file extension from swt FileDialog', 'description': "Bug 24877Cannot get file extension from swt FileDialog It makes this dialog almost unusable since we can't determine thecorrect file extension to append to the file name. ", 'OB': 'There\'s no way to get the file extension that the user selected from theFileDialog. We need an api for the filedialog to return the "Save as type" field that the user selected in theFileDialog.Athough we are using this dialog in our own product, this problem can beillustrated when you export to a jar file. ', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'Select .zip in the "Save as type"and enter a file name (eg. test). '}
